intro: Capsella australasica, commonly known as the Australian catchfly, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other well-known flowering plants. The plant produces small, white or pinkish flowers that bloom in spring and summer. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and covered in fine hairs. Capsella australasica is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats across Australia.
